qas.question: What is the name of the city's fast bus line?
When did the second line of Metrobus open?
How many people ride the Metrobus every day?
April 2012 was the year which Metrobus line opened?

context: The city's first bus rapid transit line, the <a0_0>Metrobús<a0_0/>, began operation in <a1_0>June 2005<a1_0/>, along Avenida Insurgentes. Line 2 opened in <a2_0>December 2008<a2_0/>, serving Eje 4 Sur, line 3 opened in February 2011, serving Eje 1 Poniente, and <a4_0>line 4<a4_0/> opened in April 2012 connecting the airport with San Lázaro and Buenavista Station at Insurgentes. As the microbuses were removed from its route, it was hoped that the Metrobús could reduce pollution and decrease transit time for passengers. In June 2013, Mexico City's mayor announced two more lines to come: Line 5 serving Eje 3 Oriente and Line 6 serving Eje 5 Norte. As of June 2013, 367 Metrobús buses transported <a3_0>850,000<a3_0/> passengers daily.
